title: German satirical comedian joins the Social Democrats
text:
Satirist Jan Böhmermann has his sights set on SPD leadership | Sean Gallup/Getty Images German satirical comedian joins the Social Democrats Jan Böhmermann says he has his sights set on the party leadership.

A popular German satirical comedian with a history of sparking diplomatic rows has officially joined the Social Democrats, saying he has his sights set on the party leadership.

Jan Böhmermann, who has poked fun at the party in the past, had announced his intention to lead the party on his weekly TV program in August, and was this week officially declared a party member, German media reported Wednesday.

The center-left SPD, Germany’s oldest party and Chancellor Angela Merkel’s junior coalition partner in government, has seen its popularity drop in recent years, suffering heavy losses in May's European Parliament election and struggling in recent regional ballots.

A party conference on December 6-8 will determine the party’s new leadership. Böhmermann said on Twitter that he and his team would submit his bid to the SPD conference “officially and on time, so that the delegates can decide.”

How serious he is about leading the party is the question. Böhmermann is known for pulling headline-grabbing stunts, such as reading a crude poem insulting Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on air in 2016, which prompted a weeks-long diplomatic dispute between Berlin and Ankara, and Erdoğan to sue the comedian.

Ronald Mormann, whose local party branch accepted Böhmermann's membership after internal debate, said the SPD was ready to welcome Böhmermann despite his past criticism.

"Satire can get away with a lot, and Germany's oldest party has endured a lot," Mormann said. "The German Social Democrats have fought for 156 years for people to be able to freely say their opinions." He added, however: "But we are a party and not a satirical event."
description: Jan Böhmermann says he has his sights set on the party leadership.
